com.arjuna.mw.wstx
Interface TransactionManager

public interface TransactionManager

This is the service side component of the user interface. Since services or some entity acting on their behalf (e.g., an interceptor) must enlist participants with the transaction, this interface primarily concentrates on those methods. However, a service may well not be the final destination for a transaction, i.e., in order to perform its work, the service may have to make other remote invocations on other services and propagate the context, suspend it, etc. As such, all of the UserTransaction methods are also available to the service.

Since:
1.0.
Version:
$Id: TransactionManager.java,v 1.1 2002/11/25 11:00:51 nmcl Exp $
Author:
Mark Little (mark.little@arjuna.com)

Method Detail

enlist

public void enlist(Participant participant)
            throws com.arjuna.mw.wsas.exceptions.WrongStateException,
                   DuplicateParticipantException,
                   NoTransactionException,
                   InvalidTransactionException,
                   InvalidParticipantException,
                   com.arjuna.mw.wsas.exceptions.SystemException
Enrol the specified participant in the current transaction such that it will be invoked during the two-phase commit protocol. It is illegal to call this method when no transaction is associated with the thread.
Parameters:
Participant - participant The participant to enrol.
Throws:
com.arjuna.mw.wsas.exceptions.WrongStateException - Thrown if the transaction is not in a state whereby participants can be enrolled.
DuplicateParticipantException - Thrown if the participant has already been associated with the transaction.
NoTransactionException - Thrown if there is no transaction associated with the invoking thread.
InvalidTransactionException - Thrown if the transaction associated with the thread is invalid.
InvalidParticipantException - Thrown if the participant reference is invalid.
com.arjuna.mw.wsas.exceptions.SystemException - Thrown if any other error occurs.

delist

public void delist(Participant participant)
            throws InvalidTransactionException,
                   NoTransactionException,
                   InvalidParticipantException,
                   com.arjuna.mw.wsas.exceptions.WrongStateException,
                   com.arjuna.mw.wsas.exceptions.SystemException
Cause the specified participant to resign from the transaction. CAUTION: use with *extreme* care since if invoked at the wrong time it could lead to data corruption or state modifications that are no longer under the control of the transaction. You *must* ensure that no state changes have been made that should be controlled by the specified participant.
Parameters:
Participant - participant The participant to resign.
Throws:
InvalidTransactionException - Thrown if the transaction associated with the thread is invalid.
NoTransactionException - Thrown if no transaction is associated with the invoking thread.
InvalidParticipantException - Thrown if the transaction does not know about the specified participant or the parameter is invalid.
com.arjuna.mw.wsas.exceptions.WrongStateException - Thrown if the transaction is not in a state that allows participants to resign.
com.arjuna.mw.wsas.exceptions.SystemException - Thrown if any other error occurs.

addSynchronization

public void addSynchronization(Synchronization participant)
                        throws com.arjuna.mw.wsas.exceptions.WrongStateException,
                               NoTransactionException,
                               InvalidTransactionException,
                               InvalidSynchronizationException,
                               DuplicateSynchronizationException,
                               com.arjuna.mw.wsas.exceptions.SystemException
Enlist a synchronization with the current transaction. Synchronizations do not receive the two-phase commit messages but instead are invoked prior to its start and after it has completed.
Parameters:
Synchronization - participant The synchronization to enroll.
Throws:
com.arjuna.mw.wsas.exceptions.WrongStateException - Thrown if the transaction state is such that synchronizations cannot be enrolled.
NoTransactionException - Thrown if there is no transaction associated with the invoking thread.
InvalidTransactionException - Thrown if the transaction is not top-level.
InvalidSynchronizationException - Thrown if the synchronization reference is invalid.
DuplicateSynchronizationException - Thrown if the synchronization has already been registered with the transaction.
com.arjuna.mw.wsas.exceptions.SystemException - Thrown if any other error occurs.

removeSynchronization

public void removeSynchronization(Synchronization participant)
                           throws InvalidTransactionException,
                                  NoTransactionException,
                                  InvalidSynchronizationException,
                                  com.arjuna.mw.wsas.exceptions.WrongStateException,
                                  com.arjuna.mw.wsas.exceptions.SystemException
Remove the specified synchronization participant from the transaction.
Parameters:
Synchronization - participant The participant to remove.
Throws:
InvalidTransactionException - Thrown if the transaction is not top-level.
NoTransactionException - Thrown if there is no transaction associated with the current thread.
InvalidSynchronizationException - Thrown if the transaction does not know about the specified synchronization.
com.arjuna.mw.wsas.exceptions.WrongStateException - Thrown if the state of the transaction is such that the synchronization cannot be removed.
com.arjuna.mw.wsas.exceptions.SystemException - Thrown if any other error occurs.
